fawn.def: try to gain favor by cringing or flattering

founder.def: stumble and nearly fall, fail utterly

dissolution.def: separation into component parts, the termination of a relationship

surreptitious.def: conducted with or marked by hidden aims or methods

peruse.def: examine or consider with attention and in detail

renege.def: to fail to honor a commitment; to go back on a promise

assuage.def: to make easier or milder, relieve; to quiet, calm; to put an end to, appease, satisfy, quench

equivocal.def: open to two or more interpretations

amorphous.def: having no definite form or distinct shape

din.def: a loud harsh or strident noise

magnate.def: a very wealthy or powerful businessman

discrete.def: constituting a separate entity or part

anesthetic.def: a drug that causes temporary loss of bodily sensations

monotonous.def: tediously repetitious or lacking in variety

androgynous.def: having both male and female characteristics

synergy.def: the working together of two things (muscles or drugs for example) to produce an effect greater than the sum of their individual effects

affectation.def: unnatural or artificial behavior, usually intended to impress

affable.def: courteous and pleasant, sociable, easy to speak to

reconciliation.def: the act of agreement after a quarrel, the resolution of a dispute

schism.def: division of a group into opposing factions

volatile.def: liable to lead to sudden change or violence

commensurate.def: corresponding in size or degree or extent

evanescent.def: vanishing, soon passing away; light and airy

metamorphose.def: change in outward structure or looks

unremitting.def: uninterrupted in time and indefinitely long continuing

adulterate.def: corrupt, debase, or make impure by adding a foreign or inferior substance

connoisseur.def: an expert able to appreciate a field

precursor.def: an indication of the approach of something or someone

queue.def: form a queue, form a line, stand in line

whimsical.def: determined by chance or impulse or whim rather than by necessity or reason

marginal.def: of something or someone close to a lower limit or lower class

improbable.def: not likely to be true or to occur or to have occurred

aberrant.def: markedly different from an accepted norm

plod.def: walk heavily and firmly, as when weary, or through mud

contrite.def: feeling regret for a fault or offence

bombast.def: pompous or pretentious talk or writing

engender.def: to cause, to produce, to create

conspire.def: engage in plotting or enter into a conspiracy, swear together

dogma.def: a doctrine or code of beliefs accepted as authoritative

qualm.def: uneasiness about the fitness of an action

somber.def: grave or even gloomy in character

forbearance.def: a delay in enforcing rights or claims or privileges

pedagogy.def: the activities of educating or instructing or teaching

defer.def: submit or yield to another's wish or opinion

eclectic.def: made up of a variety of sources or styles

bent.def: a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way

buttress.def: (v.) to support, prop up, strengthen; (n.) a supporting structure

intransigent.def: not capable of being swayed or diverted from a course

indifferent.def: showing no care or concern in attitude or action

allege.def: to assert without proof or confirmation

impassive.def: having or revealing little emotion or sensibility

copious.def: large in number or quantity (especially of discourse)

restitution.def: the act of restoring something to its original state

emulate.def: strive to equal or match, especially by imitating

tact.def: consideration in dealing with others and avoiding giving offence

ornery.def: having a difficult and contrary disposition

perjury.def: criminal offense of making false statements under oath

malevolent.def: wishing or appearing to wish evil to others

ambiguous.def: having more than one possible meaning

austere.def: of a stern or strict bearing or demeanor

meticulous.def: marked by extreme care in treatment of details

curmudgeon.def: a crusty irascible cantankerous old person full of stubborn ideas

innocuous.def: unlikely to harm or disturb anyone

impetuous.def: characterized by undue haste and lack of thought or deliberation

oblique.def: indirect in departing from the accepted or proper way

pine.def: have a desire for something or someone who is not present

staunch.def: firm and dependable especially in loyalty

vilify.def: to malign, to defame, to utter abusive statements against

avid.def: marked by active interest and enthusiasm

benign.def: pleasant and beneficial in nature or influence

imperturbable.def: not easily perturbed or excited or upset

prime.def: first in rank, excellence, quality, importance, or time

disparate.def: fundamentally different or distinct in quality or kind

indefatigable.def: showing sustained enthusiastic action with unflagging vitality

denigrate.def: to attack the reputation of; to speak ill of

pompous.def: overly self-important in speech and manner; excessively stately or ceremonious

reticent.def: temperamentally disinclined to talk, reluctant to draw attention to yourself

rhetoric.def: using language effectively to please or persuade

debacle.def: A complete failure; a total collapse

inherent.def: existing as an essential constituent or characteristic

furtive.def: marked by quiet and caution and secrecy

vexation.def: something or someone that causes anxiety

contiguous.def: very close or connected in space or time

waffle.def: pause or hold back in uncertainty or unwillingness

inopportune.def: coming at a bad time; not appropriate

supplant.def: take the place or move into the position of

deride.def: treat or speak of with contempt

anarchy.def: a state of lawlessness and disorder (usually resulting from a failure of government)

reverent.def: feeling or showing profound respect or veneration

irony.def: incongruity between what might be expected and what actually occurs

bellicose.def: having or showing a ready disposition to fight

forte.def: an asset of special worth or utility

viable.def: capable of life or normal growth and development

insular.def: narrowly restricted in outlook or scope

demure.def: affectedly modest or shy especially in a playful or provocative way

bedlam.def: a state of extreme confusion and disorder

abate.def: become less in amount or intensity

ominous.def: threatening or foreshadowing evil or tragic developments

corrosion.def: a state of deterioration in metals caused by oxidation or chemical action

serenity.def: the absence of mental stress or anxiety

penury.def: a state of extreme poverty or destitution

euphemism.def: an inoffensive expression that is substituted for one that is considered offensive

remuneration.def: the act of paying for goods or services or to recompense for losses

belligerent.def: given to fighting, warlike; combative, aggressive; one at war, one engaged in war

fancy.def: have a particular liking or desire for

enumerate.def: determine the number or amount of

centrifuge.def: an apparatus that uses centrifugal force to separate particles from a suspension

convention.def: something regarded as a normative example

aver.def: to declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true

brevity.def: the attribute of being brief or fleeting

itinerate.def: travel from place to place, as for work

disabuse.def: to free from deception or error, set right in ideas or thinking

daunt.def: to overcome with fear, intimidate; to dishearten, discourage

heretical.def: characterized by departure from accepted beliefs or standards

viscous.def: having a gelatinous or gluey quality, lacking in easy movement or fluidity

prune.def: weed out unwanted or unnecessary things

cower.def: To crouch or shrink away from in fear or shame

distill.def: remove impurities from, increase the concentration of, and separate through the process of distillation

espouse.def: take up the cause, ideology, practice, method, of someone and use it as one's own

dynamo.def: generator for producing electricity; energetic person

filibuster.def: a tactic for delaying or obstructing legislation by making long speeches

profuse.def: produced or growing in extreme abundance

contentious.def: involving or likely to cause controversy

waft.def: be driven or carried along, as by the air

culpable.def: deserving blame or censure as being wrong or evil or injurious

conversion.def: the act of changing from one use or function or purpose to another

refute.def: prove to be false or incorrect

divulge.def: make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret

hankering.def: a yearning for something or to do something

propagate.def: transmit or cause to broaden or spread

conspicuous.def: obvious to the eye or mind

mitigate.def: lessen or to try to lessen the seriousness or extent of

covet.def: wish, long, or crave for (something, especially the property of another person)

digress.def: wander from a direct or straight course

dispersed.def: distributed or spread over a considerable extent

partisan.def: adhering or confined to a particular sect or denomination or party

pursuant.def: in conformance to or agreement with

converge.def: move or draw together at a certain location

subtle.def: be difficult to detect or grasp by the mind

obsequious.def: attempting to win favor from influential people by flattery

trivial.def: (informal terms) small and of little importance

latent.def: potentially existing but not presently evident or realized

itinerant.def: traveling from place to place to work

stanza.def: a fixed number of lines of verse forming a unit of a poem

travesty.def: a comedy characterized by broad satire and improbable situations

deign.def: do something that one considers to be below one's dignity

vigor.def: active strength of body or mind

adherent.def: someone who believes and helps to spread the doctrine of another

ardor.def: feelings of great warmth and intensity

denounce.def: to accuse or condemn or openly or formally or brand as disgraceful

judicious.def: marked by the exercise of good judgment or common sense in practical matters

belabor.def: to work on excessively; to thrash soundly

unfettered.def: not bound by shackles and chains

cynical.def: believing the worst of human nature and motives

expel.def: force to leave or move out

peripheral.def: on or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary

avow.def: to declare or affirm solemnly and formally as true

sporadic.def: recurring in scattered and irregular or unpredictable instances

plasticity.def: the property of being physically malleable

equivocate.def: be deliberately ambiguous or unclear in order to mislead or withhold information

illusory.def: misleading, deceptive; lacking in or not based on reality

broach.def: bring up a topic for discussion

membrane.def: a thin pliable sheet of material

candor.def: the quality of being honest and straightforward in attitude and speech

extend.def: span an interval of distance, space or time

presumption.def: an assumption that is taken for granted

complement.def: something added to complete or make perfect

aesthetic.def: concerning or characterized by an appreciation of beauty or good taste

tacit.def: indicated by necessary connotation though not expressed directly

idolatrous.def: blindly or excessively devoted or adoring

remedial.def: tending or intended to rectify or improve

inundate.def: fill or cover completely, usually with water

estimable.def: deserving of respect or high regard

belie.def: to contradict, to give a false impression

placebo.def: something which has a positive mental effect, but no physical effect

secrete.def: generate and separate from cells or bodily fluids

eradicate.def: destroy completely, as if down to the roots

coercive.def: serving or intended to compel by force or authority

idiosyncracy.def: an odd, unusual, or peculiar behavior

acrid.def: harsh in taste or odor; sharp in manner or temper

gratitude.def: a feeling of thankfulness and appreciation

satire.def: witty language used to convey insults or scorn

personable.def: pleasing in appearance or personality, attractive

incubation.def: maintaining something at the most favorable temperature for its development

anomaly.def: deviation from the normal or common order or form or rule

diatribe.def: a bitter and prolonged verbal attack

exculpate.def: pronounce not guilty of criminal charges

chauvinist.def: a person with a prejudiced belief in the superiority of his or her own kind

empirical.def: derived from experiment and observation rather than theory

reconnaissance.def: exploration to gain knowledge or information

misanthrope.def: someone who dislikes people in general

discrepancy.def: a difference between conflicting facts or claims or opinions

stint.def: supply sparingly and with restricted quantities

resurrect.def: restore from a depressed, inactive, or unused state

ostentatious.def: of a display that is tawdry or vulgar

patent.def: clearly apparent or obvious to the mind or senses

makeshift.def: something contrived to meet an urgent need or emergency; done or made using whatever is available

subliminal.def: below the threshold of conscious perception

discourse.def: extended verbal expression in speech or writing

incumbent.def: the official who holds an office; lying or leaning on something else

deference.def: a disposition or tendency to yield to the will of others

decibel.def: unit of measurement for the loudness of sounds

pedantic.def: marked by a narrow focus on or display of learning especially its trivial aspects

eccentric.def: conspicuously or grossly unconventional or unusual

renaissance.def: the revival of learning and culture

misconstrue.def: to interpret wrongly, mistake the meaning of

aggregate.def: gather in a mass, sum, or whole

retard.def: cause to move more slowly or operate at a slower rate

episodic.def: occurring or appearing at usually irregular intervals

impediment.def: any structure that makes progress difficult

subpoena.def: a writ issued by court authority to compel the attendance of a witness at a judicial proceeding

paradigm.def: a standard or typical example, the generally accepted perspective of a particular discipline at a given time

bereave.def: to make desolate with loneliness and grief.

abstain.def: to choose not to do something

salve.def: anything that remedies or heals or soothes

rarefy.def: to make or become thin, less dense; to refine

amalgamate.def: to bring or combine together or with something else

quintessential.def: representing the perfect example of a class or quality

tirade.def: a long, angry speech, usually very critical

alchemy.def: a pseudoscientific forerunner of chemistry in medieval times

soliloquy.def: a (usually long) dramatic speech intended to give the illusion of unspoken reflections

advocate.def: speak, plead, or argue in favour of

discreet.def: marked by prudence or modesty and wise self-restraint

cursory.def: hasty and without attention to detail

pertinent.def: having precise or logical relevance to the matter at hand

deviance.def: a state or condition markedly different from the norm

porous.def: full of pores or vessels or holes

manifest.def: reveal its presence or make an appearance

arbitrary.def: based on or subject to individual discretion or preference or sometimes impulse or caprice

adversity.def: a state of misfortune or affliction

detraction.def: the act of discrediting or detracting from someone's reputation (especially by slander)

repudiate.def: reject as untrue, unfounded, or unjust

audacious.def: disposed to venture or take risks

ostracism.def: the act of excluding someone from society by general consent

archetype.def: an original model on which something is patterned

discretion.def: the trait of judging wisely and objectively

elucidate.def: make free from confusion or ambiguity

rue.def: sadness associated with some wrong done or some disappointment

poignant.def: deeply affecting, touching; keen or sharp in taste or smell

respite.def: a pause from doing something (as work)

zealous.def: marked by active interest and enthusiasm

anomalous.def: deviating from the general or common order or type

complaisance.def: a disposition or tendency to yield to the will of others

conciliatory.def: appeasing; soothing; showing willingness to reconcile

fallacy.def: a misconception resulting from incorrect reasoning

obdurate.def: showing unfeeling resistance to tender feelings

articulate.def: expressing yourself easily or characterized by clear expressive language

garner.def: acquire or deserve by one's efforts or actions

coalesce.def: fuse or cause to grow together

disinterest.def: lack of bias or involvement; impartiality; (ed) uninvolved; free from self-interest

cultured.def: marked by refinement in taste and manners

derision.def: the act of deriding or treating with contempt

exonerate.def: pronounce not guilty of criminal charges

mollify.def: make more temperate, acceptable, or suitable by adding something else

condone.def: excuse, overlook, or make allowances for

glib.def: marked by lack of intellectual depth

extemporaneous.def: with little or no preparation or forethought

taciturn.def: habitually silent or quiet, inclined to talk very little

admonish.def: to caution or advise against something; to scold mildly; to remind of a duty

archaic.def: so extremely old as seeming to belong to an earlier period

catalyst.def: something that causes an important event to happen

corroborate.def: establish or strengthen as with new evidence or facts

temper.def: make more temperate, acceptable, or suitable by adding something else

anthology.def: a collection of selected literary passages

tentative.def: under terms not final or fully worked out or agreed upon

introspection.def: the contemplation of your own thoughts and desires and conduct

condolence.def: an expression of sympathy with another's grief

incorrigible.def: incapable of being reformed or improved

superfluous.def: more than is needed, desired, or required

deviation.def: departure or wandering away from the accepted standard

proliferate.def: cause to grow or increase rapidly

authoritarian.def: likened to a dictator in severity

trepidation.def: a feeling of alarm or dread

animosity.def: a feeling of ill will arousing active hostility

antecedent.def: a preceding occurrence or cause or event

forswear.def: formally reject or disavow a formerly held belief, usually under pressure
